website_summaries.verdict: Professional auto mechanics and others who check multiple vehicle tires will benefit from this gauge/inflator's durability and accuracy.
pros: Measures in KG, BAR or PSI
Extremely accurate PSI readings, within .5 of a pound
cons: Valve stem can be challenging to seat without leakage

customer_reviews.title: Good quality digital tire gauge
customer_reviews.text: Likes: - Accurate (compared to my other digital tire pressure gauges). - Bright backlit LCD panel. - 0.1 psi resolution reading. - Lock-on air chuck securely attaches to a valve stem, no air leak. - Use common 2 AAA batteries, easy to replace. - Brass fittings. Dislike: None. Tip: To store the tire gauge after use, use a quick disconnect 1/4 NTP male plug and coupler to easy connect/disconnect the tire gauge to/from air compressor hose.
customer_reviews.author: Green Dragon

customer_reviews.title: This is much nicer to use than your regular air chuck
customer_reviews.text: This unit is great for filling up tires. It's a nice change compared to going back and forth between a regular air chuck and then a pressure gauge. Just release the handle for a pressure reading, hold down to add air, and hold halfway down to release air. Only way to make it better would be if the pressure readings were active while you are actually doing the inflating. You have to pause to take a reading. But still way better than the "traditional" method.
customer_reviews.author: John Shaft

customer_reviews.title: This makes putting air in tires actually fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow is this tire gauge/inflator awesome! I'm a heavy equipment mechanic but i have never owned a digital gauge/inflator before this one. This thing is a life saver and really speeds inflating tires up considerably. I used it today to put some air in my girlfriend's tires on her gmc terrain. Using the compressor on my service truck it took like 6 seconds per tire to put 10 psi each. My old tire chuck would've took so much longer! I wasn't even expecting this inflator to speed the job up, maybe just make things a little easier. I'll take it though! 5 star highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Angie Benda

customer_reviews.title: A pleasure to use, slight sealing issue
customer_reviews.text: It seals well, agrees with my analog pressure gauge, and is a pleasure to use. I like the design of the bleeder (press handle halfway to bleed). I was skeptical of the self-locking chuck after having purchased a Kobalt gauge from Lowes with a similar feature that didn't work at all, but this one seals instantly, remains attached, and (usually) doesn't leak once attached. I did have a slight problem with one of the tires on my car. The valve stem on that tire is different from the others, and I do have to manually press on the chuck to maintain a reliable seal. Despite this, I am still extremely happy with the device and would certainly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Not as rugged as it looks
customer_reviews.text: This inflator worked well for a few years, and was easy to use and fairly accurate. However it failed yesterday with the AAA batteries overheating and beginning to smoke. After disassembling the device, the cause was a battery short-circuit caused by a broken battery terminal mount, as shown in the photo. There were bits of loose plastic and the terminal spring was floating unattached. I hope a future version of this device uses an internal rechargeable lithium battery, that is recharged via a USB cable. It's unfortunate that the current version still uses AAA batteries with vulnerable terminal connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Great for Professionals
customer_reviews.text: I've had this inflator for over a year in a high volume shop environment working 40-60 hours a week and I leave this thing hanging by the clip on the end on my tool cart. I use it often every day, filling up tires and my Sureshot, and it works perfectly to this day. The braiding isn't unraveling and it still seems accurate (according to onboard tpms monitors). Cornwell sells the same one with a nicer hose for $25 more but I can't justify it
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: Almost great
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for over a year and it's almost great. The reading is consistent even though it may be 2 pounds off as I get different readings from a steel, USA made pressure gauge. I just take that into consideration when using. The light turns off too soon making it hard to read - why it's made that way I'll never know. The fitting will lock on to 7 out of 8 valve stems and why not everyone every time, I'll never know. Like I said - almost great.
customer_reviews.author: janthony

customer_reviews.title: BEST pressure gauge I've ever owned!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this gauge! First, it's HUGE! But not so big that it's cumbersome. It's built like a tank, fits your hand perfect, has a TOP quality schrader valve interface that stays put, is easy on and off, and doesn't leak. The gauge is consistent and accurate. I've owned SO many pieces of JUNK, this thing is a breath of fresh air! You will not be disappointed with this one. The backlight is also great on this. Very easy to see in the sun (ya, you kind of need it even in the sun as the LCD isn't super easy to read without the backlight, but with it, it's superb!!)
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The accuracy of the digital readout makes airing down on a trail fast and easy.
customer_reviews.text: At first I was skeptical of spending this much on a digital inflator. I was only getting it to replace the analog gauge that came with my Viair portable compressor. However, after using it would gladly pay more. Note: It works as a deflator without having to be hooked up to the compressor. The accuracy of the digital readout makes airing down on a trail fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: High volume High performance
customer_reviews.text: We have tried many other inflator gauges and found them very slow to fill, they would be great for filling bike tires at home but not in our fast paced work environment. With a one year warranty, if they last that long ,it will be well worth the price. I do wish they offered a dual chuck version but we can easily change that out. It could be a little cheaper at twice the price of most of this type of unit but sometimes you get what you pay for, sometimes.If this one holds up we will buy a couple more.We have only been using it a week or so.I will update later on.
customer_reviews.author: Mike the Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well-built (so far) tire gauge
customer_reviews.text: After going through 1 low quality/cheap tire gauge per year (Harbor Freight or similar), decided to get something nicer. This appears to be well-built/heavy, and easy to use. Have only used it a couple times, but so far impressed and looking forward to seeing how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Skycart

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a flat rate mechanic and I've used them all. This unit with a good dual head on it is by far the best. Period. Next best it BluePoint for double the money and they're not great either. I've used mine 10 times a day for 3+ years now. Now problem. This is the one. Hey Astro, word to the wise, don't be like other companies and reinvent the wheel. You have a winner here. Just leave it alone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality! Durability! Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about this when I ordered it, but when I got it I knew I did the right thing! This thing is built to last, you can feel the quality when you hold it, squeezing the handle to add air to my tires lets you feel how well built this thing is. My 68 year old brother has one that he's been using for the past 30 plus years and its still going strong, he's had zero problems with his. That's the reason I took a chance on getting one. I'm so glad I purchased this one...
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: When you remove battery pull tab make sure all of it comes out
customer_reviews.text: This tire gauge works great the only problem I had was when it came there was a tab that said "PULL" so I pulled it to activate the 2 batteries. It would not work so I removed the battery cover and found when I pulled the tab part of it stayed on the battery contacts so the batteries could not turn the unit on. After I figured this out because the piece that stayed was clear it was hard to see the gauge worked great. I am now glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D.

customer_reviews.title: Have had since 2014. Going to convert to AAA battery
customer_reviews.text: Rating of 4 stars due to limited battery life of wafer batteries and the pain of changing them. Purchased 2 cell AAA battery holder and will convert to use these batteries in the void behind the display. I will still need to disassemble to change batteries, but expecting the AAA's to last considerably longer than the small wafer battery,
customer_reviews.author: AJC

customer_reviews.title: Great gauge... But the battery is always dead
customer_reviews.text: This gauge is accurate and easy to use... When the battery isn't dead... Which is, unfortunately often. I use this gauge off and on throughout the year and about every other time I reach for it the batteries are dead. The screws that hold the case together have done ok so far but I always worry they are going to strip out during battery replacement. They are a coarse thread going into plastic. This year I am finally annoyed enough with it to switch batch to analog. Anybody interested in an air gauge with a dead battery?
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bredlie

customer_reviews.title: Best Value digital tire inflator
customer_reviews.text: I have used the MAC, harbor freight and several other digital tire inflators. Yes the MAC is a nicer tool. However for the price difference this is by far adequate for a 5 bay auto repair shop with 3 technicians sharing the use of it. On most days this gets used on 19-30 vehicles a day. Of course after 2 years there is some wear or tear and it is not perfect. I just changed jobs to a new shop and bought a new one! The 2 year old one is staying put for my guys to use at my old employer.
customer_reviews.author: chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Priced Right/Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a well priced item considering what you're getting. Comes with batteries already installed, just be sure to pull the plastic circuit breaking tab out when you go to use it. Also when attaching your air fitting to the tool, make sure you have some pipe thread sealant on hand. Conclusion: Works well, easy to use/read the display. Blue color makes for easy locating of tool although it may not stay blue for very long depending on who you are and how you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick Connect Too Large To Clear Prius Wheel Covers
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed: The quick connect doesn't work with the Prius. Either the quick connect is too large, or the standard Prius wheel covers are too small. Otherwise, this would be a good product. Fits my other two vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: I'm Just Saying

customer_reviews.title: You saw the MATCO and wanted it...
customer_reviews.text: MATCO. This is the same exact inflator as the tool truck sells for a third of the price. It works flawlessly. My only complaint, and it's not enough of a detractor to drop it to 4 stars, is that the deflation rate is not very quick. If you are using it on smaller tires, automotive, or heavy truck tires it is fine. I use it on large tractor/combine tires a lot, which are way over-inflated during shipping, so it takes a while to deflate. Easier to remove the valve core on those. Don't pay tool-truck price, buy it here instead.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Shaver Jr

customer_reviews.title: Decent for commercial use
customer_reviews.text: I use this knock-off look alike every day at work about 10 times a day. The quality is amazingly good for the price. I expect the only thing that will break it (without abusing the tool) would be dropping it on the hose where it screws to the handle. The display numbers are large and clear. The backlight is very bright and stays on for several seconds. I will be purchasing another one for use at home.
customer_reviews.author: Steve C

customer_reviews.title: The best tire inflater ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an analog inflator that was hard to read. This unit has a huge lit digital display that you will not need your readers. The hand grip fits the hand easily and is a joy to use. I never had an easier time inflating tires. Very glad I spent the extra dollars and bought this unit. It is very well made. The only negative I can think of is I wish the backlight would stay on longer after I push the button. Only stays lit for a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: N. Marko

customer_reviews.title: Relatively Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Have had this now for about a month and have used it to check/adjust the pressure in the tires on four vehicles, including the 60psi spares. It is solid, heavy duty and relatively well built. Schrader fitting is heavy duty and works well with no leaks and stays on valve stem. Easy to connect to compressor line and easy to increase/decrease tire pressure. Display is easy to read. My only gripe is with the battery access: folding back the rubber cover will eventually cause it to distort and/or rip. A small pull-open flap in the rubber cover would have been much easier to use and would last a lot longer. Overall I am relatively happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny_R

customer_reviews.title: 4 years and still going!
customer_reviews.text: Going on 4 years with mine. Hose does have a small kink on it, but always works and is always accurate. I do not use my guage for work, only for occasional home use about 3 to 4 times a month(my cars can't hold air worth a crap!). Seems well built. If this thing ever dies out on me, I would definitely buy the same brand again. Can't say how well this would hold up in a shop setting, but for it's price, I would give it a go.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel V.

customer_reviews.title: Good but large
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old gauge for my motorcycle. the locking head is too large to use on my rear tire because of the spokes. this will become my car gauge and I will find another for the bike. I like its accuracy and otherwise ease of use but wish it had a right angle chuck to get to my back tire.
customer_reviews.author: R. T. Firefly

customer_reviews.title: Professional Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am an A&P mechanic although I do not earn a living working on any airplane other than my own. The quality of this product is great. I suspect Astro is providing them to Snap On for their Bluepoint line. Worth the dollars for the time it saves.
customer_reviews.author: Skypilot 18

customer_reviews.title: Numero Uno: It's accurate. And nicely made.
customer_reviews.text: After sending back a similar gauge that was inaccurate, I have found the Astro to be within a pound of what my digital tire pressure gauges show. And it looks like very good quality, right down to the well-machined and easy fitting valve stem chuck. It also has a certificate of accuracy testing, like a good torque wrench or vernier caliper. Well worth the extra twenty bucks for those who appreciate using good tools.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: When you don't want to spend extra for blue point.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: price Accurate enough. Read 1psi below. Easy battery replacement Con. Brass fitting on my hose blew. The top rubber loop ripped Overall average. Been using it for a year. Wish it came with dual head chuck. And brass coupling could of been stronger. Update: Astro send me a new updated hose. Been using it for few month, it's been working pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: M&H

customer_reviews.title: Mechanics choice
customer_reviews.text: Works great. It's exactly like the bluepoint version. It's really the best air gauge for any mechanic. It's as high quality as they come at a fraction of the price of snap-on (bluepoint), Mac, or Matco.
customer_reviews.author: garrett

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother with anything else
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this product enough. As a professional mechanic I have had my share of tire gauges but this one is by far the best. I bought my first one off the tool truck for almost twice as much and was so impressed by it I bought a second one on Amazon to use at home. It is easy to use and accurate. I have had my first one for several years of hard daily use and it's still working great. Don't bother with any other tire gauge just get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Gee

customer_reviews.title: Good as it gets for the money
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy seems to be spot on with my unit. I would recommend using the KPA setting because it's a finer unit of measurement vs PSI. I use this gauge frequently on all of my vehicles and it's holding up well. It's a great value and would highly recommend it to anyone that needs accuracy in tire pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Cross

customer_reviews.title: Identical to the Matco air Chuck.
customer_reviews.text: This is identical to the$180 Matco air Chuck. Completely identical. Only difference is the Matco one is red and this one is blue.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: A very good gauge
customer_reviews.text: I modified mine to use a push-on air chuck from a different air filler and I love it. The only complaint is that the light turns off on the gauge too quickly, but it works very well. I like that it takes normal batteries. For working on Bikes, it is the bomb.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Typical Astro Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a seriously well-made tool. I've wanted an inflator like this for years and when Astro came out with the AAA battery version, I pulled the trigger. The quality is top-notch, from the ruggedized rubber exterior, to the braided-stainless steel hose. I've doubled checked the pressure readings against two other gauges, including a very expensive Joe's Racing product. The Astro tool always reads within 1 psi of the other gauges. This is for home use, in my case, but I think this product would easily handle all-day use in a garage environment. If you can afford to spend a bit more $$ for a really nice inflator, buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Vegoose

customer_reviews.title: High quality works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It’s funny. Never even knew something like this existed in this price range. Used it for the first time to check the pressure on my 5th Wheel. Takes 80lbs and all 4 were at 44.8lbs. Yikes! Filled all 4 to the required 80lbs like nothing. So easy while I was at it I checked and adjusted all 3 cars, bikes, pressure washer, wheel barrow... everything with a rubber tire filled with air. Heck it was almost fun. Don’t hesitate, it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Thacker

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty chill gauge
customer_reviews.text: It's a great pressure gauge. I love the braided hose cause I've seen a million of the plain rubber ones get cracked and break. Also this one takes a couple triple a batteries instead of the older ones that take those stupid watch style batteries that nobody likes to buy. For some reason though there are some pressures that don't register. For example the gauge will never read 34.5. It will go from 34.4 to 34.6. Every time haha. Not that it's a big deal or anything, it's just an interesting observation. It's a good price too. I just wish it had a button to power off
customer_reviews.author: D2S

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be quality made.
customer_reviews.text: Only used it 8 times so far. Will update as time goes on. Very sturdy in hand. Hope it lasts forever. I like this product. I treat all my tools well. Meaning, I don't throw them around or pile a bunch of stuff on them.
customer_reviews.author: heraldo

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: Quite convenient. The "quick clip" to the valve stem is super easy to use. My only complaint is that is doesn't read as you inflate, you have to release the trigger to get your PSI. same for deflation. You have to keep checking.
customer_reviews.author: JessD

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but the Best
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have spent a lot of time and money, looking for the best and, the important, accurate tire pressure. The Astro Pneumatics tire pressure gauge fits the bill. Easy to read and the lock-on air chuck is a great feature. It is well constructed and the rubber cover protects the gauge from bumps and drops.
customer_reviews.author: CAD-Man

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire Gauge!
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool everyday for work. It works well for what it is. I like the fact that it's digital and has a blue back-light if I need it. The only issue is that the screen is covered by clear plastic, which does protect the actual screen but over time, you may get scuffs or scratches on the plastic. This sometimes makes it a little difficult to see if the light hits it just right. Other than that, I'd definitely buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Very cost-effective compared to Tool trucks
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tool it is easy to read the display. High quality workmanship I've only had a short time so I'm not really sure about battery life yet but overall I'm very happy with the tool. Change quality is the Matco one at half the price for a little less than half the price
customer_reviews.author: michael hoey

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life!
customer_reviews.text: This inflator is sweet, it’s quick, easy to use and accurate. I only wish I’d bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce McElhaney

customer_reviews.title: Defective unit.
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift. Piece of junk. Display does not work. Looks like it has been used. I suspect it was returned as a defective item and the re-sold as a new item. Since I bought it well before my nephew's Birthday, it is past the return window. Worst item and experience with Amazon ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This inflator makes quick work of inflating and deflating tires. The digital readout is easy to see and it seems very accurate. You can also order replacement parts from their website so the unit can be serviced. This makes the initial cost a little easier to handle. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: John Rupe

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I'd been looking to purchase a tire inflator with an automatic digital pressure reader for some time. I did some research and originally thought I wanted a portable/battery operated stand-alone unit. After digging a bit deeper, I decided to go with this unit since I had an air compressor. I used it this morning and loved it. It's super easy and quick to use and it seems to be of good build quality. The only thing that was "wrong" is that the batteries that came with the unit were dead. I just replaced them with ones I had and it worked just fine. I'd highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: StringsAttached

customer_reviews.title: Display stopped working - FIXED
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 2 hours. Everything was fine, but now the backlight is on, but there are no numbers showing up. The button does nothing and it won’t shut off. So now it’s useless. Expected a lot more use than only filling up 6 tires before it breaks! Took out batteries for a few hours and the gauge reset itself and it has worked very well for the last 8 months. I now recommend this product and seller as they offered a replacement as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse smith

customer_reviews.title: don't buy from a tool guy
customer_reviews.text: inflate and deflates fast took the clip end off and installed my dual end so I can get to the spare tires its the same unit that the tool guys are selling for double the price or more.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have Matco and this one, I think they are made by the same Manufacturer because they’re the exact same thing. No complaints at all. And great company overall. Mine stopped working from the screen (dropped the gauge) and I send it in to then and they repaired it free of charge. 5 stars tool hands down.
customer_reviews.author: carlos

customer_reviews.title: I should had purchased this long ago!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one easy to use product for men and women! Very good quality, easy to read with built in light and automatically shuts off after 90 seconds. I have never had such an easy time with checking tire pressure and either filling or release some air to the exact manufacturers specs!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A.

customer_reviews.title: Wish i got it years ago
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought this year's ago. It is accurate based on comparison to my calibrated gauges as well as my cars TPS system. It's the first tire fill that has ever clamped and held on any valve stem I put it on without leaking one bit. I was amazed. It's easy to fill or deflate to get exact pressure. The gauge lights up and is easy to read. It has rubber protection all around it and the hose is stainless braided line. Treat it like a precision tool and I think it will last. Don't drop, kick, drop kick or run it over and it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: MikeDaytona675

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, questionable longevity
customer_reviews.text: Looks like they've made a few changes since I got mine 06/15. Lasted almost 2 years, now inconsistent readings. I will try again, if it goes bad again I will find a brand higher in the market. Works great when it works but I don't want to keep replacing them out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Adam from NY

customer_reviews.title: If you're concerned about weight verses pressure on a big RV then this gauge is for you.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality gauge, easy to use and see the readings with accuracy I've never had before.. Allows for venting and filling... I use it for anything from my riding lawn mower tire at 6 psi to my RV at 90 psi. Easy crimp connection to tire fill valve for hands off use after connection. However I have one valve extender on the rear dually RV tire that I have to position several times to get it to push in on the valve extender needle for it to work. I think that's an issue with the extender and not the gauge, but be aware of the possibility.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Sands

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic unit
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for a couple weeks now and I love it. I’m a general service tech at a high volume Goodyear and it gets used about 30 times per day. I use it, my colleagues use it instead of the shop inflator, it is utterly fantastic. Tires up to 80 psi on occasion and it has no issues. My boss hasn’t worked in the shop in years and has considered buying one. In the short time I have had it, it has paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Butterboy

customer_reviews.title: nice!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this for a while before I reviewed it. Though I use it for a variety of tire types, I bought it mainly to get accurate pressures in ATV tires, which are very low pressure. I cannot say the gauge is accurate - I don't know. The only thing I have to compare to is one of those cheap pencil gauges. I will say that repeated readings are consistent to the 1/10 of a pound at pressures of 5-6 PSI. I am very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: old texasguy

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a problem with the chuck leaking every time I use it. I have to spend several seconds trying to get it to stop leaking and sometimes I can't. Not good when you use it constantly in a professional manner. No response from Astro either. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great inflator
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, locks on, and easy to read. It's a little large, but that makes it easy to read and use. Very similar to what they use in professional shops.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built digital air pressure gauge!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice digital tire inflator that’s built solid. This is the same tire inflator that Matco sells for over twice as much. It has a backlit display and can measure tire pressure in several different units. The stainless steel braided hose is nice and flexible and the chuck is built solid too. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Erik W.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to read digital gauge tire inflator
customer_reviews.text: The inflator unit worked with gauge worked just as soon as I placed the batteries that were supplied into the compartment. The instructions were very good about battery placement and how to change measurement units. The inflator chuck locked on properly and I was able to hit the proper air pressure for each tire accurately which is critical for both of our TPMS equipped automobiles. I plan to use it on our RV as well for proper tire pressure and air bag suspension inflation requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality but use a PZ1 screw driver bit to remove the screws!
customer_reviews.text: Man this looks great after receiving today. Installing the battery was a bitch with using a p1bit so i tried a pz1 bit & worked like a charm. I also cut bigger slot with razor blade to be able to see & remove the screws. I used some 3-in-1 oil to lube the screws before installing them back. The screen turn right on but the LCD "ghosted" on the positive side on decimal. I have not hooked up to air yet but I am praying that it is not a problem. I will give an update as soon a i file my warranty card & use for a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Mel's Mobile Services

customer_reviews.title: Won’t turn on and hanging loop tears easily.
customer_reviews.text: Won’t power on most of the time. The loop on top for handing inflator ripped after a week. I have the old version of this and it lasted for over 5 years. This one barely lasted two weeks and constantly won’t turn on. Pretty useless and now I can’t hang it up either. Put it back in the box and bought another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for a Great Price! Good for Professional Use
customer_reviews.text: Many guys buy from the Matco truck at my work. I noticed that this one is identical to the one sold on the Matco truck, except this one is twenty dollars cheaper. There are advantages and disadvantages to buying on the tool truck. But if you are like me and want decent quality for a good price, than this is a great product. I use it at work everyday. It is accurate and fills the tire faster than a normal tire air chuck. Also the release air feature is great too. Will update if I have any problems. I recommend this to everyone, especially people in a professional work environment.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob C.

customer_reviews.title: Only thing I can say is - this is the ...
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I can say is - this is the same exact pressure gauge as a snap on or matco one - just doesn't have the name on it - you can have one for $60-$80 cheaper - over all - owned for two weeks now and it has been used every day for 10 hours each day - I let my whole shop use it because I'm confident enough that it hold up to all the drops and being beat up - not that fancy blue any more but it's holding up
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The gauge is inaccurate. It will read around 300-400PSI ...
customer_reviews.text: The gauge is inaccurate. It will read around 300-400PSI when the tire really only has 35PSI in it. Maybe this one is a dud, but I am returning it and buying one from a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I like that it uses normal batteries instead of those button type batteries...
customer_reviews.author: Puhi Performance

customer_reviews.title: I
customer_reviews.text: This gauge seems to be accurate. When the trigger is pressed half way, it lets air from the tire out, and pressed all the way it inflated the tire. The display with the light makes it very useful in dark places. It’s a must have
customer_reviews.author: sal

customer_reviews.title: It's bored straight so that it did not get a full ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally, my tires are properly inflated. Knocked off one star for the shape of the tip that attaches to the tire valve. It's bored straight so that it did not get a good seal to the fat valves on my new Ford Edge. A few seconds with a 45 degree countersink bit fixed that issue. But, for the price of this unit, the manufacturer should have done that.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Protect your Investment.
customer_reviews.text: So, this tool is good, but you will find the hose gets old and worn too quickly. If you are a mechanic and will be using this alot it does its job, but get the warranty. Trying many different tools that do the same job, this is by far the best, but protect your investment.
customer_reviews.author: audrionna

customer_reviews.title: Poor long term quality.
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay for a little over a year, but then gauge became flaky, and quit completely recently. Only used about a dozen times. Disappointing quality.
customer_reviews.author: Noble

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very accurate.
customer_reviews.text: This inflator works great - I like the .1 PSI resolution on the gauge. I can now set all four tires to the exact pressure. My TPMS dash display now matches the tire gauge. I had a handheld digital gauge that turned out to be about 2 PSI low so my TPMS never matched the pressure I was putting in the tires. This gauge is spot on. I have no issues at all with the clip grabbing on to the tire valve - you just have to push it on with sufficient force and then let loose of the clip.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: TODAYS pressure gauge with YESTERDAYS air chuck
customer_reviews.text: Super good quality, ( 5 STARS ) but the air chuck that goes on the tire stem is like a bowling ball ! ( quality of chuck is very good as well ) Chuck is so large that it will NOT fit quite a LOT of newer cars since the wheel covers have smaller stem holes. The smaller push on and hold style of chuck really should come with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: phils

customer_reviews.title: Easy battery change!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was concerned that installing the battery was going to be a chore. Well I received it today and to my surprise, it took all of about 45 seconds to install the battery. Maybe I got lucky, but I used a #2 phillips head and they came out wit ease. This thing is bulletproof. The quality is great. From the rubber that encases the whole thing, to the hose, and the chuck, everything seems to be top notch. I haven't checked the accuracy on it yet, but I don't have any doubts that it will be accurate. This is well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: vegasnoid

customer_reviews.title: I like the way the inflator feels in my hand and filling multiple tires goes very fast.
customer_reviews.text: I use the astro 3018 inflator to fill about 12 tires and it worked very well and exactly as described .Did not have any issues at all and Inserting the batteries was not bad. The unit seems to be very well built and feels good in the hand with the heavy-duty rubber casing .I like the fact that I can over inflate a couple psi and deflate it down to exactly what I need all with one unit. The unit is all you need to fill and check psi on your tires.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great cost and extremely accurate
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for two years already and cannot complain. Much accurate than old school tire guages. These newer cars are very sensitive to tire pressure so its imperitive you have a reliable and accurate guage. Heavy duty built as well, dropped mine plenty of times and still works today. Only bad thing is the battery will have to be replaced at one point but even the tool truck electronic guages will too. Must have for the automotive technician and the price is unbeatable. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Nice but......
customer_reviews.text: This works well with a few quirks. It's bulky, and the chuck doesn't fit any smaller valve stems like motorcycles. Had to replace immediately. Also the chuck doesn't pivot making the new angled chuck hard to bend into position of valve stem. Remedied this by reversing hose because the hose pivots where is connects to the gauge. Works way better now. Also when you add air it seems to read the pressure in the hose momentarily giving you false readings for a moment. You have to fidget with it every time. It may get easier to work with as I've only had for a few days...
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for daily use.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. If the battery gets low the psi gets way above what it actually is. I was checking vehicle tire pressure and it told me that they were around 90 PSI. Changed batteries and it worked normally again.
customer_reviews.author: David Bent

customer_reviews.title: Great Must Have Tool.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is amazing. It works great. I started using it for autocross without an air tank. After a few runs, the pressure goes up and I use the tool to check and lower the pressure. It works even better if you have to add air. You can add (or remove) and then check the pressure very rapidly. It works so well, I am going to purchase another one for use at home with my regular cars. I have several GM cars with TPMS. This tool is wonderfull for the "teaching" process where you have to let air out then put the pressue back when you are done.
customer_reviews.author: VetteZ06

customer_reviews.title: Finally a good inflator
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a good inflator. My last two inflators let me down, so it was time to change things Characteristics of cheap inflators: Inaccurate Break (hoses split, dials break, lose accuracy over time) Chuck falls off the stem Inflates slowly Characteristics of this inflator: Accurate (calibrated from factory) Seems heavy and well built. Lots of rubber protection. Chuck stays on the stem, by itself. Inflates FAST. Thank you, good inflator. The cheap inflators can get F'ed.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Clark

customer_reviews.title: Best Air Chuck for the money.
customer_reviews.text: OK, this has got to be the very BEST air chuck I have ever used, bar none. Easy to connect, stays connected, readout is large and clear, and back lit in dim or no light, inflate and deflate positions on the handle, readout in 10's of a pound, just everything you need. Very well made and armored exterior for durability.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Good so far. The construction appears sturdy and the design is well thought out. The chuck works as it should, and I really like the long braided hose. Powering the unit with the two easily changed AAA batteries is a good idea. This gauge consistently indicates 2 pounds less the the Joes's Racing gauge that I use as my measurement standard. That's not too bad, but I do wish that this one agreed with the unit that I know is accurate. I just hope that this inflator continues to perform well with extended use, as it is very convenient to use.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Makes inflating fun!
customer_reviews.text: Can't speak to the durability as I just got it, but using this vs. the way I've been doing it for 30 years is a godsend. I can't wait for some tires to get low now.
customer_reviews.author: ShayneG

customer_reviews.title: Kind of works, wish it was better quality.
customer_reviews.text: Use it once a month on 2 cars. 5 month in, led backlight wont remain on, shuts off after 5-10sec. 1yr in, brass fitting on the hose broke off for no reason(started leaking a lot of air, when i touched it, it snapped). Replacement host is 16$. Other than this works as designed. Why not make it better quality and charge 5-10$ more?
customer_reviews.author: M.K.

customer_reviews.title: Real sturdy quality feel to it overall
customer_reviews.text: Real sturdy quality feel to it overall. Clamps on easily and is easy to use. Purchased for motorhome tires, because it takes a long time to pump one up and if you have to bend over and hold the bit on the tire-stem your tire your back will hurt after finishing just one tire. With this I can stand up and just look down at the pressure on occasion. Really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Milam

customer_reviews.title: Inflator with a digital gage...
customer_reviews.text: I've been struggling with finding a set of tire pressure gages that will read relatively close to each other, so I bought a few to try out. I purchased this one to fill the tiress and one small gage for each car, then took them to my usual tire store. They compared them all with their set, this one was spot on every time. I am very happy with the gage, it has a decent length of hose, and I like the clip to keep it on the valve stem. I read a couple other reviews about the screws for the battery being a pain, but I didn't have any trouble getting it open...
customer_reviews.author: svodriver

customer_reviews.title: This product works great. Its easy to read and could also read ...
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. Its easy to read and could also read different measurement types. 1 disadvantage is this thing is huge. Could take up quite a bit of space if you are looking to keep it in the glove compartment. Other than that, great product at a reasonable price. Finally, this product stated that it has lithium batteries within the package. I have looked through the whole package and i can only find alkaline batteries(AAA) that came with the product. Astro might want to relook into this as this is providing misleading information as air shipping is sensitive towards lithium equipped products.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Tire pressure gauge and air chuck.
customer_reviews.text: Lights up and digital. Uses double A batteries. Accurate. I have bought several gauges and this is the most accurate I’ve found..looks just like a matco but color is different. Much cheaper. Wouldn’t be surprised if they’re made in same factory. Of course you need an air compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Ricks

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've had this on our farm using it for trucks, cars, and tractors. It is really easy to use and convenient and when comparing it to other pressure gauges, I think it pretty accurate. Replacing the battery is a little difficult due to the small size of the rubber holes in the back that you have to insert a screw driver into. I've never dropped the gauge more than a few inches, but it feels very solid and the handle valve works great. It is easy to both inflate and deflate the tire and really saves time if you have many vehicles with dual-tires.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Tarbet

customer_reviews.title: Feel like a pro now...
customer_reviews.text: Love it... I have a TPMS sensor system that i can check on my dash (2013 Camaro). I am kinda OCD about checking it and making sure my tires are exactly what they are supposed to be. Kinda funny how i went to Discount Tire (a professional tire place) and i had to correct their error of incorrect psi. Wish the blue/background light would stay on for a bit longer, but i can live with it. I feel like a total pro with this, and i can definitely feel when my car is riding smooth with the right amount of psi in the tires.
customer_reviews.author: Pat B

customer_reviews.title: awesome inflator/gauge
customer_reviews.text: love it .as soon as i tried this out i knew i had to take it to work with me at least once . I work at a body shop . everyone was impressed and had to know where i got it . the tool trucks had very similar ones but for a lot more money . i maintain our automobiles ,three riding mowers , and everything else at home , this comes in very handy . if something happened to it today i would order another right away i love it that much .
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and it’s so easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! No issues with this, and it’s easy to use. Bought one as a gift for my Dad after my husband loved his so much!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!!
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing a couple of inferior inflation gauges at the big box stores, I found this one from Astro. After reading the reviews and comparing it to other products, I decided to give it a try. It was definitely a good purchase. This thing is very easy to use and you can inflate your tires in .1 increments. I use it mainly for my cars, lawnmowers, snowblower, and dirt bike, and it is exactly what I needed. Mine came with the braided stainless steel hose and AAA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tire inflator gauge!
customer_reviews.text: I love this digital tire inflator! It's so easy to use with my compressor. All I do is attach the spring-loaded chuck to the valve stem, push the ON button and pull the hand lever until I reach my pressure and if I overshoot, just pull the hand halfway to release pressure. I've had this gauge for several months and am impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: GizmoGuy

customer_reviews.title: The Best Tire Inflator
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading the reviews, I was skeptical because of some reviewers saying you had to dismantle the gauge to replace the battery. All I can say, is that those people that wrote those reviews DID NOT READ the instructions. I have bought several of the harbor freight inflators and they are junk, this one is awesome! It's worth the money. The gage is very accurate, and I like the deflate feature which makes it really nice to let out air This is a must own...
customer_reviews.author: Darren Chaney

customer_reviews.title: Great Gauge!!!
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it the read out wasn't working...but I put new batteries in and it works Great. It is the Best gauge I've used and it's easy since you never need to remove it from the tire stem until your pressure you want is perfect!! Hold it to put air in...then push lightly to release air...all while it's attached to the tire stem. Great idea!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nightowl

customer_reviews.title: Well made, accurate. The last gauge you will ever need.
customer_reviews.text: Done wasting money on $20 gauges. They don’t last. The last one was bad right out of the package. This Astro gauge is outstanding. Very well made and worth every penny. Buy it you won’t be dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Makes inflating tires much easier and quicker. Seems to correlate with other pressure meters. So far no issues.
customer_reviews.author: MDJ

customer_reviews.title: This is a quality tool and is very convenient to use I am a home owner so I don't really worry how accurate it is and I don't ha
customer_reviews.text: As usual when I use Amazon it gets hear very fast, This is a quality tool and is very convenient to use I am a home owner so I don't really worry how accurate it is and I don't have anything better to check it against anyway. I like the toughness large dial and valve stem clip , I use it for changing my own tires and the trigger is very nice to use for airing up and then once the bead is set letting the air back out.
customer_reviews.author: REO

customer_reviews.title: Straight From The Source
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. Use this daily and the price beats the tool trucks... which are made by this company for one tool company in particular
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Great Gauge
customer_reviews.text: Very rugged and easy to read. The batteries have been moved to the side of the unit and are much more accessible than previous versions with the battery access on the back and the need of a screwdriver. Ready to use right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Lobstha

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed that it was made in China
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that it was made in China. I had researched beforehand and was unable to find its origin. However, it is high quality, and works well. I have added a quick change adapter to it, take it off the hose after I use it and return it to its box for storage. I think it will last a long time. As far as the battery issue some have had, I think it is best to follow the directions of the previous reviewers. I use it a few times a week and have calibrated it against a tester and it is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Get it now!!!
customer_reviews.text: You're right! This is the one! The exact same thing everyone paid $200 for off of the tool truck! Get it and brag. And when they say " blah blah blah warranty" , tell them that's cuck speak for " I paid for it 3x over so they'll give me a new one because they owe me"
customer_reviews.author: guile

product_meta.title: Astro Pneumatic Tool 3018 3.5" Digital Tire Inflator with Hose
product_meta.description: Size:3018The Astro 3018 3.5" Digital Tire Inflator with Hose boasts a durable 21” stainless steel braided hose for increase durability and an easy to install AAA Battery System for 4X the battery life. Inflate, deflate and measure in KG, PSI or BAR with maximum accuracy and 0.1psi resolution for use with TPMS (Tire Pressure Monitoring System). This unit is designed with a large face backlit LCD digital read-out and is covered with a rubber sleeve for extra comfort and durability. Specifications: Measuring Range: 3 ~ 175PSI, Units: PSI/BAR/KPA/KGF, Resolution: 0.1 PSI, Accuracy: 0 – 58 psi +/- 1.2 PSI, 59 – 174 psi +/- 1.2 PSI, Working Temperature: 32°F~104°F (=0°C~ 40°C), Power: (2) AAA Batteries, Battery Lifetime: 560hr
feature_bullets: New dual AAA battery powered design. 4X the battery life and simplified battery installation.
New 21” Stainless braided hose for increased durability
Maximum accuracy and 0.1psi resolution for use with TPMS (Tire Pressure Monitoring System)
Displays KG, PSI or BAR measurement
Large face backlit LCD digital read-out
Unit covered with rubber sleeve for extra comfort and durability
Works on with nitrogen systems and CO₂
Two position lever. 1st position deflates, 2nd position inflates.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,953 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
